title: Console 2.jpg
description:
Looking for multiple tabs solution for Cygwin terminal for a long time.

I used to use mrxvt which built from source codes to run on Windows 7, but crashed on Windows XP. Then tried WinTabber, a nice tool can integrate a few native Windows applications into tabs window but keeps crashing after a certain time.

At last, I give Console 2 a try. Very stable with the basic tab feature I want. Check at: http://sourceforge.net/projects/console/
comments.comment:
Give a try to ConEmu http://sourceforge.net/projects/conemu/ Hanselman's post about it http://www.hanselman.com/blog/ConEmuTheWindowsTerminalConsolePromptWeveBeenWaitingFor.aspx and some user reviews http://stackoverflow.com/a/10904494/1405560; a different way to go, which has other nice features is 'screen' http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/how-to-use-screen-command-under-linux.html; Screen is not a Windows program.; I use a really stable one at work... will post the details tomorrow.; no it doesn't run in windows, you run screen on whatever server you are logging into with the terminal. screen then provides multiple 'tabs' within the one session, as well as saving those terminal sessions. I find it better than having tab support in the terminal program itself.; +Dean Budd I use Linux - crisis over :p; +Terrence Miao  WindowTabs is the utility I use. That way I can use mintty for my cygwin terminal emulator.; +Kieran Simpson there's an old saying... "Life's too short for Linux" O:-); I don't know man, given the amount of stress I've endured using Windoz, I swear I've lost a couple of decades :p hahaha; all OS cause stresses, just depends on what you're trying to do. for dev, anything other than linux just sucks. problem is when you're doing .net or ios dev; you don't get a choice :(; I don't mind OSX for dev work either (once MacPorts is installed).; I must have deleted my comment. WindowTabs has the answers you seek!; I switch to Windows Tab now, after follow Deano's tip.

Console 2 is good, but it doesn't support mintty, which is my main terminal. Setting shell to mintty in Console 2 causes Windows crashed. Using Cygwin as shell in Console 2, OK, but selected text can't be highlighted.

Trail version of Window Tabs only support three tabs in one group. But can run many tab groups at the same time ...

Bow to Deano!; ConEmu does not suite you request? Did you try it?; +Maximus ConEmu I did give ConEmu try. It's quite good and powerful tool, working with Cygwin mintty; select, highlight, copy, middle button paste between different terminals all work well. The only issue is it's too powerful, it can do many things. My requirement is multiple tabs feature in Cygwin mintty. So the smaller tool, simple add-on is better.

But thanks for ConEmu tip! ; Wow, "too powerful" ;) But, I'm pleased that tests passed in your env.
